ANU.name: Danielle Ingle
interest: My research focuses on using the latest in DNA sequencing technologies and computer-based analyses to understand the evolution and epidemiology of bacteria. In particular, I focus upon enteric bacteria causing gastro-intestinal disease, including Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica and Shigella species, that are significant human pathogens

ANDS-Grants.description: Microbial genomics is a powerful laboratory tool to characterise human pathogens at the highest level, allowing greater understanding of the source and spread of pathogens that infect humans. In this project, through close links with the Victorian Government, we will determine how this exciting new technology can best be applied to prevent the spread of high risk human pathogens, and inform public health action.
ANDS-Grants.title: An evidence based framework for establishing public health microbial genomics in Australia
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
subjects: communicable disease | antibiotic resistance | salmonella | sexually-transmitted infections (sti) | genomics
